header.name: PositionX
header.description: X starts at left side of image, can be negative

header.name: PositionY
header.description: Y starts at top side of image, can be negative

data: Cold, dank and reeking of infection. That's how Hope fares in Wraeclast.
The cliffs echo the hungry madness.
Despite the warming sun, the breeze here bites with fangs of ice.
Mud and air seethes with warped life.
Slime, shadow, and sharp sharp teeth.
Dusty winds laden with the scent of bone, old and otherwise.
The cliffs glower down like judges in session.
The air is rich with despair and apparition.
The cliffs watch with goatish eyes.
Whispered agonies of the marooned dead.
The air needles the skin with its frigid fury.
DEV NOTE: Off map pip for Way Forward quest
DEV NOTE: Off map pip for Way Forward quest
A remnant of civility in the wild.
Sick pastures, feverish to the touch.
Hot and sour as the panting of a rabid bear.
Life struggles where once it bloomed.
Stones worn smooth by centuries of devotion.
A pure, soothing river once red and clogged with the victims of war.
Once tamed rivers now running free.
Bathed in the cool light of obsession.
Corrupted waters, pouring from the Mantle above.
The ground aches with desecration. The rain tastes of blight.
The forging ground of heroes, past and present.
A harsh light on harsh sights.
Only the wind whistles and whines here now.
All the money in the world can't stop a world from ending.
Coughing up the dust of dead devotion.
Charred flesh and spilled bowels. Sweet and sour.
An empire at its height, reflected in polished gold.
An empire at its height, reflected in polished gold.
Life pales in the wake of progress.
What horrors lurk in the bowels of the city?
Nature outgrows the designs of Man.
All the knowledge in the Empire could not save them.
The pinnacle of power. The height of hubris.
A frail scab of hope holds Nightmare at bay.
The rushing lifeblood of a long-dead Empire.
Bones of betrayal, ashes of purity.
Gifts of the Beast, awaiting plunder.
Fury and flame come to life.
No matter how far you climb, you never escape the Pits.
The greater the rise, the greater the fall.
Vengeance is the slave's ultimate reward.
In Oriath's darkest corner, the spark of rebellion ignites.
The illusion of control is swiftly severed by the blade of reality.
What was once the heart of the city is now the heart of the battle.
Oriath's bleeding heart is the main course in a terrible feast.
Only those with faithful eyes may enter these solemn chambers unbidden.
Fuelled by blood and chaos, a dark inferno engulfs the halls of justice.
In this holiest of sanctums, the High Templar communes with God and delivers His divine judgement.
The faithful dead watch over the city with hollow eyes.
A trove of shameful relics displayed with pride.
Atop this burning monument to arrogance, Oriath's final hope remains.
The shivering tides bring little hope, only desperation and despair.
Those that now wash ashore seek no warmth or shelter, only to fill a bottomless void of pain and hunger.
The Ancestors return to conquer these shores once again.
As the tide rises, hope is drowned.
Mud and blood make a fine war paint.
The waters here, once stagnant and foul, now run clear with an ancient bloodlust.
The air is thin, the way is narrow.
Echoes of the past bring new life to an old experiment.
The hunting grounds of a cloven god.
What madness flitters and creeps through the darkened trees?
These violent waters carry portents of death.
A corpulent grub flails mindlessly, infesting the putrescent muck.
Insidious pupa populate under sweltering heat.
Stalactites drip in mourning for an ocean queen.
An echo of destiny consumes the land.
A coral throne for a salt-soured god.
Surviving rodents cling tight to cracks found in the masonry.
The stonework trembles atop this petrified land.
Ancient cruelty tears through the cobbled intersection.
A spirit of sadism blemishes the earth.
Ancestral memories given life, then soured.
Decrepit ruins born again. A lusting evil stalks its halls.
The inner depths of decadent darkness.
Sodden spores flourish and feast on decaying flesh.
Dripping with anger and grief, the ancient thicket weeps.
Ancient and arcane, a civilisation lost to the dust of history.
Arachnoid servants dribble and drool, coveting pilgrim flesh to feed abhorrent desires.
A parapet shakes beneath a billowing sky.
A shaky peace descends, though swords will never rest.
Spells of blood foul the waters below.
A favourite walk of noble lords, now fallen into disrepair.
Creeping dread chokes life from this thriving terrace.
Allegiances falter like the waning of the moon.
Gibbous beauty eclipsed by a sisters' feud.
The restless dead shift 'neath darkened waters.
A barrier trembles before undying feet.
The savagery of war stains both muck and mire.
Conquered by the fog of war.
Luminary flares extinguished by burning pride.
A dark unrest sends ribbons to war.
A mighty spillway tainted by tarrish blacks and sanguine reds.
Survivors huddle 'neath baleful shadows of rot and decay.
A freezing drop to test one's resolve.
Blustering sand, sharper than a bandit's blade.
A paradise hidden amongst sunbleached bones and blistering dunes.
The secrets of history lie hidden among layers of dirt and sand.
These corrosive waters devour both flesh and bone.
Unspeakable horrors filigree and haunt the nameless dark.
A monstrous terror stalks chthonic mines, yearning for the boundless sky.
Madness was visited upon those who dug too deep.
Once flushed with the warmness of blood, now festering; consumed by fungal rot.
The putrid interior oozes and spoils.
A final refuge, backed hard against the waves of a raging sea.
From above, the true scope of carnage is clearly espied.
A flourishing place of trade, barely recognizable amidst the countless deaths.
Pious priests once dealt cruel justice within these halls, now they both smoulder in silent agony.
Mad men toil under smoking skies to pervert a holy sanctum.
A man-made rupture from which both blood and water flow.
Cries of torment and pathetic moans as the unholy banquet of flesh continues.
Sadists and cut-throats break both bone and brain.
Empty, broken shelves linger, looted and forgotten in the wake of this horrid war.
The dead offer thanks, for they have been spared this final savagery.
A new dawn rises on ruined stone. Hand in hand, those that remain toil for a better world.
The fates of two peoples now stand reversed, but history has taught the Oriathans humility and the Karui mercy.
Thaumaturgists once sought ever greater knowledge. Now they run and hide like all the others.
Pious priests once dealt cruel justice within these halls, now they both smoulder in silent agony.
Empty, broken shelves linger, looted and forgotten in the wake of this horrid war.
